verses.verse: Moreover Ahithophel<WH302> said<WH559> unto Absalom<WH53>, Let me now choose out<WH977> twelve<WH8147><WH6240> thousand<WH505> men<WH376>, and I will arise<WH6965> and pursue<WH7291> after<WH310> David<WH1732> this night<WH3915>:

And I will bring back<WH7725> all the people<WH5971> unto thee: the man<WH376> whom thou seekest<WH1245> is as if all returned<WH7725>: so all the people<WH5971> shall be in peace<WH7965>.
And the saying<WH1697> pleased<WH3474> Absalom<WH53> well<WH5869>, and all the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>.
Then said<WH559> Absalom<WH53>, Call<WH7121> now Hushai<WH2365> the Archite<WH757> also, and let us hear<WH8085> likewise what he saith<WH6310>.

And when Hushai<WH2365> was come<WH935> to Absalom<WH53>, Absalom<WH53> spake<WH559> unto him, saying<WH559>, Ahithophel<WH302> hath spoken<WH1696> after this manner<WH1697>: shall we do<WH6213> after his saying<WH1697>? if not; speak<WH1696> thou.
And Hushai<WH2365> said<WH559> unto Absalom<WH53>, The counsel<WH6098> that Ahithophel<WH302> hath given<WH3289> is not good<WH2896> at this time<WH6471>.

For, said<WH559> Hushai<WH2365>, thou knowest<WH3045> thy father<WH1> and his men<WH582>, that they be mighty men<WH1368>, and they be chafed<WH4751> in their minds<WH5315>, as a bear<WH1677> robbed<WH7909> of her whelps in the field<WH7704>: and thy father<WH1> is a man<WH376> of war<WH4421>, and will not lodge<WH3885> with the people<WH5971>.

Behold, he is hid<WH2244> now in some<WH259> pit<WH6354>, or in some<WH259> other place<WH4725>: and it will come to pass, when some of them be overthrown<WH5307> at the first<WH8462>, that whosoever<WH8085> heareth<WH8085> it will say<WH559>, There is a slaughter<WH4046> among the people<WH5971> that follow<WH310> Absalom<WH53>.

And he also that is valiant<WH1121><WH2428>, whose heart<WH3820> is as the heart<WH3820> of a lion<WH738>, shall utterly<WH4549> melt<WH4549>: for all Israel<WH3478> knoweth<WH3045> that thy father<WH1> is a mighty man<WH1368>, and they which be with him are valiant<WH2428> men<WH1121>.

Therefore I counsel<WH3289> that all Israel<WH3478> be generally<WH622> gathered<WH622> unto thee, from Dan<WH1835> even to Beer-sheba<WH884>, as the sand<WH2344> that is by the sea<WH3220> for multitude<WH7230>; and that thou go<WH1980> to battle<WH7128> in thine own person<WH6440>.

So shall we come<WH935> upon him in some<WH259> place<WH4725> where he shall be found<WH4672>, and we will light<WH5168> upon him as the dew<WH2919> falleth<WH5307> on the ground<WH127>: and of him and of all the men<WH582> that are with him there shall not be left<WH3498> so much as<WH1571> one<WH259>.

Moreover, if<WH518> he be gotten<WH622> into a city<WH5892>, then shall all Israel<WH3478> bring<WH5375> ropes<WH2256> to that city<WH5892>, and we will draw<WH5498> it into the river<WH5158>, until there be not one<WH1571> small stone<WH6872> found<WH4672> there.

And Absalom<WH53> and all the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559>, The counsel<WH6098> of Hushai<WH2365> the Archite<WH757> is better<WH2896> than the counsel<WH6098> of Ahithophel<WH302>. For the LORD<WH3068> had appointed<WH6680> to defeat<WH6565> the good<WH2896> counsel<WH6098> of Ahithophel<WH302>, to the intent<WH5668> that the LORD<WH3068> might bring<WH935> evil<WH7451> upon Absalom<WH53>.

¶ Then said<WH559> Hushai<WH2365> unto Zadok<WH6659> and to Abiathar<WH54> the priests<WH3548>, Thus and thus did Ahithophel<WH302> counsel<WH3289> Absalom<WH53> and the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>; and thus and thus have I counselled<WH3289>.

Now therefore send<WH7971> quickly<WH4120>, and tell<WH5046> David<WH1732>, saying<WH559>, Lodge<WH3885> not this night<WH3915> in the plains<WH6160><WH5679> of the wilderness<WH4057>, but speedily<WH5674> pass over<WH5674>; lest the king<WH4428> be swallowed up<WH1104>, and all the people<WH5971> that are with him.

Now Jonathan<WH3083> and Ahimaaz<WH290> stayed<WH5975> by En-rogel<WH5883>; for they might<WH3201> not be seen<WH7200> to come<WH935> into the city<WH5892>: and a wench<WH8198> went<WH1980> and told<WH5046> them; and they went<WH3212> and told<WH5046> king<WH4428> David<WH1732>.

Nevertheless a lad<WH5288> saw<WH7200> them, and told<WH5046> Absalom<WH53>: but they went<WH3212> both<WH8147> of them away quickly<WH4120>, and came<WH935> to a man's<WH376> house<WH1004> in Bahurim<WH980>, which had a well<WH875> in his court<WH2691>; whither<WH8033> they went down<WH3381>.

And the woman<WH802> took<WH3947> and spread<WH6566> a covering<WH4539> over the well's<WH875> mouth<WH6440>, and spread<WH7849> ground corn<WH7383> thereon; and the thing<WH1697> was not known<WH3045>.

And when Absalom's<WH53> servants<WH5650> came<WH935> to the woman<WH802> to the house<WH1004>, they said<WH559>, Where is Ahimaaz<WH290> and Jonathan<WH3083>? And the woman<WH802> said<WH559> unto them, They be gone over<WH5674> the brook<WH4323> of water<WH4325>. And when they had sought<WH1245> and could not find<WH4672> them, they returned<WH7725> to Jerusalem<WH3389>.

And it came to pass, after<WH310> they were departed<WH3212>, that they came up<WH5927> out of the well<WH875>, and went<WH3212> and told<WH5046> king<WH4428> David<WH1732>, and said<WH559> unto David<WH1732>, Arise<WH6965>, and pass quickly<WH4120> over<WH5674> the water<WH4325>: for thus hath Ahithophel<WH302> counselled<WH3289> against you.

Then David<WH1732> arose<WH6965>, and all the people<WH5971> that were with him, and they passed over<WH5674> Jordan<WH3383>: by the morning<WH1242> light<WH216> there lacked<WH5737> not one<WH259> of them that was not gone over<WH5674> Jordan<WH3383>.

¶ And when Ahithophel<WH302> saw<WH7200> that his counsel<WH6098> was not followed<WH6213>, he saddled<WH2280> his ass<WH2543>, and arose<WH6965>, and gat him home<WH3212> to his house<WH1004>, to his city<WH5892>, and put his household<WH1004> in order<WH6680>, and hanged<WH2614> himself, and died<WH4191>, and was buried<WH6912> in the sepulchre<WH6913> of his father<WH1>.
Then David<WH1732> came<WH935> to Mahanaim<WH4266>. And Absalom<WH53> passed over<WH5674> Jordan<WH3383>, he and all the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> with him.

¶ And Absalom<WH53> made<WH7760> Amasa<WH6021> captain of the host<WH6635> instead of Joab<WH3097>: which Amasa<WH6021> was a man's<WH376> son<WH1121>, whose name<WH8034> was Ithra<WH3501> an Israelite<WH3481>, that went in<WH935> to Abigail<WH26> the daughter<WH1323> of Nahash<WH5176>, sister<WH269> to Zeruiah<WH6870> Joab's<WH3097> mother<WH517>.
So Israel<WH3478> and Absalom<WH53> pitched<WH2583> in the land<WH776> of Gilead<WH1568>.

¶ And it came to pass, when David<WH1732> was come<WH935> to Mahanaim<WH4266>, that Shobi<WH7629> the son<WH1121> of Nahash<WH5176> of Rabbah<WH7237> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, and Machir<WH4353> the son<WH1121> of Ammiel<WH5988> of Lo-debar<WH3810>, and Barzillai<WH1271> the Gileadite<WH1569> of Rogelim<WH7274>,
